name: Poha
history: Poha is a traditional Indian breakfast dish made from flattened rice. It's popular for its lightness and quick preparation time.
description: Poha is a nutritious snack prepared from flattened rice, seasoned with onions, mustard seeds, and a variety of spices and herbs.

equipment.name: skillet
equipment.description: A flat-bottomed pan used for frying, searing, and browning foods.

equipment.name: cutting board
equipment.description: A durable board on which to place ingredients for cutting.

equipment.name: colander
equipment.description: A bowl-shaped kitchen utensil with holes for draining liquids from food, used here for rinsing poha.

equipment.name: spatula
equipment.description: A broad, flat, flexible blade used to mix, spread, and lift material.

equipment.name: mixing bowl
equipment.description: A bowl used for mixing ingredients.

instructions.title: Prepare Ingredients
instructions.description: Chop the onion, green chili, and coriander leaves. Measure out all other ingredients and have them ready.

instructions.title: Rinse and Soften Poha
instructions.description: Gently rinse the flattened rice in cold water until it softens. Drain the water and set it aside.

instructions.title: Temper Spices
instructions.description: Heat oil in the skillet, add mustard seeds. Once they start crackling, add chopped onions, green chilies, and curry leaves. Cook until onions are soft.

instructions.title: Cook Poha
instructions.description: Add turmeric powder and salt to the skillet. Then, mix in the softened poha. Stir gently and cook for 3-4 minutes.

instructions.title: Garnish and Serve
instructions.description: Remove from heat. Add chopped coriander leaves and lemon juice. Mix gently and serve.

tips: Rinsing poha just until it softens is crucial, as over-soaking can make it mushy.
Adjust green chilies to suit your spice preference.
variations: Add vegetables like peas, carrots, or potatoes for added nutrition.

storage.shelfLife: Poha is best consumed fresh but can be refrigerated for up to 1 day. Reheat before serving.
storage.instructions: Store in an airtight container in the refrigerator.

reheatingInstructions: Reheat in a microwave or on a stovetop until warm.
presentationTips: Garnish with sev or freshly grated coconut for added flavor.
